skill.name: github-workflow-automation
skill.description: Advanced GitHub Actions workflow automation with AI swarm coordination, intelligent CI/CD pipelines, and comprehensive repository management
skill.summary: Advanced GitHub Actions workflow automation with AI swarm coordination, intelligent CI/CD pipelines,...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This skill provides legitimate GitHub workflow automation capabilities but requires elevated permissions for repository management, workflow execution, and multi-agent coordination. While the functionality appears genuine, users should be aware of the broad access requirements.

medium_findings.title: Broad GitHub CLI permissions required
medium_findings.description: The skill requires GitHub CLI with authenticated access, enabling repository manipulation, issue creation, PR management, and deployment actions. This could be misused if the skill is compromised.

medium_findings.title: External package dependencies with network access
medium_findings.description: Skill requires installation of external packages (claude-flow@alpha, ruv-swarm) that have network capabilities and could potentially access sensitive repository data.

low_findings.title: Workflow templates include shell script execution
low_findings.description: Generated GitHub Actions workflows execute shell commands that could be modified if input validation is insufficient, though this is standard for CI/CD systems.

content.user_title: Automate GitHub workflows with AI swarm intelligence
content.value_statement: Managing complex GitHub Actions workflows manually is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill uses AI swarm coordination to automatically generate, optimize, and manage intelligent CI/CD pipelines that adapt to your codebase.
actual_capabilities: Generate optimized GitHub Actions workflows based on codebase analysis
Coordinate multi-agent swarm for parallel PR validation and testing
Automatically detect programming languages and create appropriate pipelines
Perform intelligent security scanning and compliance checks
Optimize workflow performance and cost through parallelization
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI authentication and repository permissions
Network access needed for GitHub API interactions
Advanced features require understanding of CI/CD concepts

use_cases.title: Automate multi-repository releases
use_cases.description: Coordinate releases across multiple repositories with intelligent dependency management and automated rollback capabilities

use_cases.title: Smart PR validation pipeline
use_cases.description: Automatically spawn multiple agents to lint, test, security-scan, and review pull requests in parallel

use_cases.title: Self-healing CI workflows
use_cases.description: Create workflows that automatically diagnose failures, suggest fixes, and create pull requests to resolve issues

prompt_templates.title: Generate workflow
prompt_templates.scenario: Create CI/CD pipeline for Node.js project
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an optimized GitHub Actions workflow for my Node.js Express API. Include testing, linting, security scanning, and deployment to staging environment

prompt_templates.title: Optimize existing workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my current workflow file and suggest optimizations for faster execution, better caching, and parallelization opportunities

prompt_templates.title: Security audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a comprehensive security audit of my repository using swarm agents. Check for vulnerabilities, exposed secrets, and compliance issues

prompt_templates.title: Multi-repo coordination
prompt_templates.prompt: Coordinate a version update release across 5 microservice repositories. Update dependencies, align versions, create changelogs, and manage PRs

output_examples.input: Generate a CI/CD workflow for my Python Django application with testing and deployment
output: - Estimated build time: 8 minutes (optimized from 15 minutes)

best_practices: Always test generated workflows in a separate branch before merging to main
Use repository secrets for sensitive configuration like API keys and deployment tokens
Enable workflow monitoring to track performance improvements over time
anti_patterns: Do not run workflows with excessive permissions - follow least-privilege principle
Avoid hardcoding sensitive data directly in workflow files
Never skip security scanning in production workflows

faq.question: Is this compatible with GitHub Enterprise?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works with GitHub Enterprise Cloud and Server editions through the GitHub CLI

faq.question: What are the rate limits for GitHub API calls?
faq.answer: The skill respects GitHub's rate limits and implements intelligent batching to minimize API usage

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing CI/CD tools?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill generates standard GitHub Actions workflows that can call external tools and services

faq.question: How does the skill handle sensitive data?
faq.answer: All sensitive data should be stored in GitHub Secrets and accessed through environment variables in workflows

faq.question: What should I do if a workflow fails?
faq.answer: Use the self-healing capabilities to automatically diagnose issues and create fix pull requests

faq.question: How does this compare to other CI/CD automation tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered optimization and swarm coordination specifically for GitHub Actions, with intelligent adaptation to your codebase
